title: Poisoning Treatment
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: Call 911 if the person:
content: Poisoning in children is serious. Get emergency help immediately if you think a child has taken poison and they’re acting differently or you have any other concerns.
bullets: Is having trouble breathing or has stopped breathing

items: Is having trouble breathing or has stopped breathing

content_blocks.text: Poisoning in children is serious. Get emergency help immediately if you think a child has taken poison and they’re acting differently or you have any other concerns.

sections.heading: Call Poison Control if:
content: Call the poison control center at 800-222-1222 if the person has done any of these things and is alert:
You may not be sure whether a child has ingested something. Call poison control if they are alert and:
bullets: Swallowed too much medicine or the wrong kind
Gotten poison on the skin or in the eye
Swallowed a household product or other chemical
Have pieces of pills on clothes or lips

content_blocks.text: Call the poison control center at 800-222-1222 if the person has done any of these things and is alert:
associated_bullets: Swallowed too much medicine or the wrong kind
Gotten poison on the skin or in the eye
Swallowed a household product or other chemical

content_blocks.text: You may not be sure whether a child has ingested something. Call poison control if they are alert and:
associated_bullets: Have pieces of pills on clothes or lips

sections.heading: Treat Symptoms as Directed
content: Follow the instructions of emergency personnel or poison control.

content_blocks.text: Follow the instructions of emergency personnel or poison control.

sources: American Association of Poison Control Centers: "First Aid Tips."

meta_description: WebMD walks you through the steps for emergency treatment of poisoning.
